place.name: SOUTH RESTON
place.gazetteerText: RESTON (South), a parish, with a village, in Louth district, Lincoln; 2 miles N N E of Authorpe r. station, and 6 S E of Louth. Post-town, Louth. Acres, 710. Real property, £1, 312. Pop., 235. Houses, 51. The property is divided among a few. S. R. Hall is the seat of W. Hay, Esq. There is a brick and tile manufactory. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £180. Patron, the Duchy of Lancaster. The church was rebuilt in 1865; and is in the early English style. There are chapels for Wesleyans and Free Methodists, a parochial school, and charities £7. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
